page.title: 18Manor Farm, North Boarhunt
page.content: {Manor Farm}was more than likely owned by a Knight, which at the time was a manor and not a farm. The farm itself has been in the present family since l92l and has been handed down through the generations. The farm deals with beef cattle, wheat and potatoes. {The present farmhouse is about {5OO years old.}The dull, red brick building is large with heavy oak beams and flagstone floors. The house has a Norman arch, baking ovens and a dairy. {There is a water well in the hall {which is now covered over. With the farm are five old barns and three new iron ones. There is an old granary and a small pond. The farm became linked with Southwick when{William of Wykeham, as Bishop of {Winchester}received the property for {Southwick Priory in l367.
